scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains letters to his friend John Wilson Townsend, Kentucky author and bookseller, emphasizing the value of their friendship, as well as discussing his political opinion of Kennedy and the election of 1960, and the work of Joe Jordan and Edgar Lee Masters.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart, University of Cairo, to John Wilson Townsend 1960 Aug 26

scopecontent.p: Reflects on their trip through Italy en route to Egypt; encourages him; reminds him of the time they first met in Lexington, Kentucky; assures him of his friendship; states ideas on children and parents; remembers his parents, their passing, etc.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John Wilson Townsend 1960 Oct 3

scopecontent.p: Advises him on the sale of book; says he is outraged by some people's attitude; talks about a book by Joe Jordan, whom he believes deserves the Pulitzer Prize as did Edgar Lee Masters; reflects on upcoming general elections; gives reasons for his dislike of John F. Kennedy, and why he is a Richard Nixon supporter now; calls New York's mayor Wagner the most corrupt creature in existence who is not up to his job.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John Wilson Townsend 1960 Oct 23

scopecontent.p: Argues that Townsend is still interested in staying alive or he would not have such interest in ball games; wants the Pirates to win the world series; advises him on health and diet, not to get mad all the time, do some laughing; says he is very impressed by young Randy Blake.

did.unittitle: Jesse Stuart to John Wilson Townsend 1961 Jan 4
Jesse Stuart to John Wilson Townsend 1961 Feb 19

scopecontent.p: Discusses his writings; mentions one book that has become a collector's item; speaks about his new book which got wonderful reviews back home; talks about visit to a pyramid and the Sahara; refers to Dr. Woodbridge of Murray State College, Kentucky, his book Tim.
